teams.name: Pakistan
teams.whereabouts: Pakistanis and friends of Pakistan worldwide!
teams.loan_because: We wish to encourage and support ambitious hard-working people all over Pakistan, in a dignified and empowering manner.
teams.description:
"If you want others to be happy, practice compassion. If you want to be happy, practice compassion." - Dalai Lama

We are a group of generous, warm and benevolent individuals from all over the world, tackling poverty in Pakistan one loan at a time.

teams.name: Team Katcova Singapore
teams.loan_because: My work requires frequent travelling and I saw so much poverty around the globe. There are many families without proper drinking water, roofs and sanitation. I really feel that Kiva is doing so many beautiful stuffs here and i wanted so much to be part of it.  Then I have shared with my husband and friends, who were amazing, kind and generous. I hope to get more people to feel attracted to Kiva, excited about microlending, and more connected to the rest of the world.
teams.description:
Why Katcova?
Katherine is my name and i am obsessed with COnnection and Value-Adding to our lives. Thus, KATCOVA was born.

Its fate that brought us together. Every one is so friendly and beautiful and its so incredible bless and lucky that they have crossed my path in this journey of my life.

teams.name: milepoint
teams.loan_because: As travelers we have seen poverty first hand and are committed to making the world a better place for all.
teams.description: Travelers who collect miles and points and seek free flights, hotel rooms and upgrades where possible. Here we seek to give back and invite everyone to join with us and make a difference.

teams.name: Nerdfighters
teams.loan_because:
We aim to decrease world suck.

And this is how:
www.eludehcs.no/kiva/nerdfighters/nerdfighters20120916.png by Nerdfighter Ole Bendik
teams.description:
We're Nerdfighters! We fight against suck; we fight for awesome! We fight using our brains, our hearts, our calculators, and our trombones.

Happy lending!

Follow us on twitter: https://twitter.com/KivaNerds

teams.name: Australia
teams.loan_because:
Australians all let us rejoice
for we are young and free,    -   
We've heard the call of nations wide,
How can we let this be?    -   
We'll share our wealth,
We'll make the change,
We'll help to set them free   -   
From us to them
and back again, 
As one we all shall be      - 

(Thanks to member Jean for this one)

Find us on Facebook at http://www.facebook.com/group.php?gid=97953452142
teams.description: Kiva Loaners in Australia

teams.name: Médecins Sans Frontières / Doctors Without Borders
teams.description:
This Kiva team makes loans in honor of Doctors Without Borders / Médecins Sans Frontières (MSF). Médecins Sans Frontières is an international medical humanitarian organization created by doctors and journalists in France in 1971.

According to their website, MSF provides aid in nearly 60 countries to people whose survival is threatened by violence, neglect, or catastrophe, primarily due to armed conflict, epidemics, malnutrition, exclusion from health care, or natural disasters.

MSF operates independently of any political, military, or religious agenda.  In 1999, MSF won the Nobel Peace Prize.

The Kiva team is not officially linked to MSF. All loans made in the name of this team, remain the property of the lender, and are not considered a donation.

teams.name: Poverty2Prosperity.org - Poverty-Escape
teams.loan_because: Poverty2Prosperity.org (P2P) is all about Poverty-Escape. Please join our fun team and put Poverty-Escape in the lead!  See how to get your I'm a Kiva Loaner Bracelet and more by participating on Team P2P - visit our web site for details!
teams.description:
One of P2P's major poverty-escaping projects is to participate in making microloans through the Kiva platform. See the web site for details on all of our projects. Also see our Perpetual Fund lender account which allows people to designate funds for perpetual loaning here on Kiva, http://www.kiva.org/lender/P2PPerpetualFund

We have a special purpose fund to keep loans from expiring. Please join us at http://poverty2prosperity.org/sosloans to see currently funding loans from the SOS Loan fund.

NOTE:  Poverty2Prosperity is also a non-profit, and any messages not related to Kiva or Poverty2Prosperity may be deleted.  If there is an idea you would like to share, contact one of the Team Captains to get permission.  Thank you for your consideration.

teams.name: Friends of Bob Harris
teams.loan_because:
After stumbling into a job as a luxury travel writer, I saw so much poverty that I decided to turn those paychecks into Kiva loans. Then I visited a bunch of clients, who were amazing, and I've written a book about it called "The International Bank of Bob" (Walker/Bloomsbury, March 5, 2013).

I hope the book will get more people to feel a greater understanding of Kiva, a better appreciation of the role of microfinance, and most of all, more connected to the rest of the world.
teams.description: People who realize that if we switched places with the recipients, they'd loan to us just as happily.  So, fair's fair.

teams.name: NWTF PHILIPPINES

1. NWTF can be TRUSTED (see their financial reports pp. 20-21 at their 2010 ANNUAL REPORT. http://nwtf.ph/reports/annual/AR2010.pdf

3. NWTF's clients have shown consistent repayment PERFORMANCE (see p.19 of the 2010 ANNUAL REPORT. http://nwtf.ph/reports/annual/AR2010.pdf
teams.description:
VISIT & EXPLORE : www.nwtf.ph
  NWTF has struck me as an organization that has the well-being of its member clients at the heart of all its activities. It is a pioneer in social performance management, and uses the progress out of poverty index (developed by Grameen) to measure a clients' poverty level following each loan cycle." Joanne, Kiva Fellow (volunteer)

teams.name: Kiva Peru

teams.description: A group of individuals coming together to help Peruvians.

teams.name: Team Peru
teams.loan_because: We want to help everyone (not just Peru) build a better future
teams.description: We love Peru!

teams.name: Manuela Ramos
teams.loan_because: We believe that women should be presented with economic opportunity and the ability to advance themselves and their families through sustainable small business growth.

teams.name: PeruFund
teams.loan_because:
Even all the way back to Inca times, the Mita system, or public service allowed Peruvians to build communal facilities, such structures like Machu Picchu and the Inca Trail system than runs all the way from Ecuador to Argentina.

This is why we would like to support Peruvian entrepreneurship groups, to empower them and to promote the century long tradition of working along neighbors to reach common goals.
teams.description: Everyone who is interested in seeing Peru become an example of sustainable and collaborative development, PLEASE SUPPORT THIS TEAM. Many emerging countries can learn from the Peruvian tradition of entrepreneurship and community work!

teams.name: Nine50
teams.loan_because: Nine50 imports Silver Jewellery from South America to Australia. Nine50 is committed to helping the people of Peru through various projects including Kiva.

teams.name: VIDA USA & VIDA PERU
teams.loan_because: To reach those living by simple means whose lives become endangered by mother nature's wrath and to inspire the creative entrepreneurs.
teams.description: Our group supports the power of the people of Latin America. VIDA is an ngo that ships medical supplies to 14 countries In Latin America - particularly in times of disasters- such as the recent earthquakes in Haiti and Chile.

teams.name: Friends of Edpyme Alternativa supporting rural Peru!
teams.loan_because: We believe in extending competitive financial services to individuals and small sized business owners, who many times would be completely excluded from formal credit channels.
teams.description: A team who enthusiastically supports the efforts of Edpyme Alternativa's fantastic work in the region of Northern Peru and supports its innovative approach to reach difficult areas in the region.

teams.name: Friends of Microfinanzas PRISMA (MFP)
teams.loan_because:
We believe in Microfinanzas PRISMA's mission to "bring financial services and non-financial services to disadvantaged communities in order to strengthen them, and promote sustainable social and economic development."

Nosotros creemos en la misión de Microfinanzas PRISMA, "Brindar servicios financieros y no financieros integrados a población con menos oportunidades, para fortalecer sus capacidades y promover su desarrollo social y económico de forma sostenible."
teams.description:
We are a group of friends and staff of Microfinanzas PRISMA that want to help families in Peru realize their dreams. We live in Peru and around the world. 

Somos un grupo de amigos y empleados de Microfinanzas PRISMA que quieren a ayudar familias de Peru a lograr sus sueños. Vivimos en Peru y alrededor del mundo.

teams.name: Friends of Peru State College

teams.description: We are  friends of college students who study  organizational ethics and social entrepreneurship at Peru State College in Southeast Nebraska.

teams.name: Amigos de Caja Rural Señor de Luren

teams.description: Show the true nature of people who support Perussuomalaiset (The Finns Party), a political party in Finland.

teams.name: Peruanos en USA
teams.loan_because: We want to give back something that we all ready received

teams.name: Ferreyra Family
teams.loan_because: Hi, I’m  Sebastián (22) from Lima, Perú. I'm a good student of Economics and finance. I'm here cuz my mom and I have a bussiness idea. She makes very nice quilts and comforters, also, knows how to make a quilt becomes pillow, it's really awesome. I think this business could work very well and in the long term we project diversify the supply to products especially designed for the bedroom.
teams.description: We are a good family. Martha is an interior designer, Cristina studying for dentistry and I will be soon an Economist. Just we are keen to take forward a business, we have good ideas, I know very well the financial theory and together make a great team.

teams.name: Iguana Host
teams.loan_because:
Everyone deserves their chance.

Economic empowerment provides the most sustainable form of humanitarian aid.

We are doing nothing more than helping others in ways we would wish them to help us had our roles been reversed.
teams.description: Iguana Host helps companies and individuals build an online presence. We provide services focused on bringing  our customers the most effective web experience  tailored to their needs.

teams.name: Changes for New Hope
teams.loan_because: We want to change the part of the world that we can touch. We see poverty and the deseperation it instills, especially in children and focus to eliminate that to the degree that we can.
teams.description: Changes for New Hope, formerly Esperanza de Cambio, is a registered NGO in Huaraz Peru developing the lives of children and their families living in poverty. Creating and supporting microbusinesses is one way we can manage poverty. We help local people to become self sufficient.

teams.name: Amazon - Selva - Sustainability and Entrepreneurship
teams.loan_because: Why loan? Because the Amazon is a unique, special place... a place so special it is impossible to articulate with words or share with photos/ videos the feelings which stir when you step foot in the Amazon. One must travel there, and have met the people who live there, to know they are themselves poor, but the most generous people in the world at the same time. We loan to empower entrepreneurs in the Amazon who aspire to empower themselves and their families through sustainable business.
teams.description: First, we are people who have visited the Amazon, from the Amazon, or have family roots with the Amazon.  It is said, “once you step food in the Amazon, you will always have the Amazon in your heart, and you will always aspire to return one day."   Second, we’re people from around the world who recognize what the Amazon represents for the planet and aspire to help empower the people living there. Third, we’re good people of integrity who are in some way drawn to MicroFinance and the Amazon.

teams.name: Pakistan
teams.whereabouts: Pakistanis and friends of Pakistan worldwide!
teams.loan_because: We wish to encourage and support ambitious hard-working people all over Pakistan, in a dignified and empowering manner.

teams.name: Pilipinas
teams.loan_because:
We CAN help our kababayans be financially independent.

Let us provide the nets so they can fish.
teams.description:
This is OUR CHANCE to GIVE OUR COUNTRYMEN A CHANCE!!!

Your $25 will go a long, long way to create livelihood opportunities for our kababayans. Let us help them help themselves. Let us empower them to help lift themselves out of poverty.  And ... YOU GET YOUR MONEY BACK because they will pay you back!

To find a Filipino entrepreneurs, click on the LEND button and just type in "Philippines" in the search field. There are always a few new entrepreneurs on a daily basis. But if you don't see one on that day. Try again the following day.

Lend - NOW!!!!

teams.name: Norway
teams.loan_because:
We have Cold Weather - Warm hearts !
We believe that providing microloans to entrepreneurs in developing countries is the socially responsive way of helping people break the circle of poverty. 

We promote Kiva.org as a sustainable and transparent way of connecting lenders and borrowers from across the globe.
teams.description:
Bruk denne linken for å invitere dine venner til teamet her:
http://www.kiva.org/team/norway/recruit

Det er flott hvis du trykker Facebook "anbefale/recommend" knappen oppe til høyre  på denne siden. Vår facebookgruppe: http://www.facebook.com/pages/Kiva-Norway/193432017389484

Anbefalte lån "sikrere" lån: 
http://www.kiva.org/lend?sortBy=partner_default_min=0&partner_default_max=0.5&partner_risk_rating_min=1&partner_risk_rating_max=5&partner_arrears_min=0&partner_arrears_max=1.1&sortBy=repaymentTerm
Hjelp med "expiring loans": http://poverty2prosperity.org/sosloans/#fundraising_loans

Hjelp med "postdisbursed" lån:
http://kivatools.com/fundraising/postdisbursedloans

Kiva tools:
https://www.kiva.org/portfolio/collections
http://www.bhodisoft.com/kiva-country-collector/
http://www.bhodisoft.com/kfpc/
http://www.kivalens.org

Da har vi nådd målet på 2 million dollar utlånt. Takk til alle som har bidratt!

teams.name: España - Spain
teams.loan_because: Kiva ofrece un medio ideal para participar activamente en el apoyo a emprendedores sin recursos que no pueden acceder a los canales normales de financiación y que, gracias a los micro-créditos, pueden  desarrollar una actividad empresarial que les permita, a ellos y su entorno, alcanzar una mejor calidad de vida.
teams.description:
Este club se creó con la intención inicial de fomentar la participación de españolas y españoles en Kiva, no obstante,  está abierto a todas las personas que deseen unirse a él, sin importar su nacionalidad ni ninguna otra condición.
 
El único referente identitario de este grupo es la solidaridad y la convicción de que, a través de Kiva, es posible el apoyo a personas o grupos emprendedores que buscan y merecen una oportunidad por su esfuerzo.

teams.name: Team Europe
teams.loan_because: We think Kiva is a unique opportunity for people all over the world to assist entrepreneurs in improving their businesses and communities.
teams.description: We are European lenders (EU, EFTA, and all those who feel they belong) who share the belief in Kiva's vision.

teams.name: Safe Girls Team
teams.loan_because: By empowering girls and women in the fight for women's rights, poverty reduction, education and health promotion, we are helping to create a fairer and better world for everyone.
teams.description:
This team supports the work of Kiva, improving the lives of people around the world who have limited financial means, and who would not otherwise have the means to improve their lives, those of their families, and their communities.

We also raise awareness of the issues of  violence against girls and women including fgm, education, maternal health and human rights.

This month we deal with the issue of Human Trafficking, a problem fuelled by poverty, and one which affects millions of women and children every year.

 A video explanation of what Trafficking is:

www.no-trafficking.org/

 A personal account:

http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/world/europe/7243612.stm

Videos:

www.theguardian.com/global-development/audioslideshow/2013/dec/11/human-cost-sex-trafficking-prostitution-audio-slideshow

www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-us-canada-18144333

This four week free of charge course on Human Trafficking begins on 20th August, 2014.

www.coursera.org/course/humantrafficking

 Detailed information about child trafficking:

www.childtrafficking.com/Content/sitemap.php

 To report a trafficking crime:

 In the USA:

www.fbi.gov/about-us/investigate/civilrights/human_trafficking

 In the UK:

https://crimestoppers-uk.org/get-involved/our-campaigns/national-campaigns/human-trafficking

Courses our team members might be interested in joining for free: 

Coursera:     
                                              
https://www.coursera.org/course/water 26th May, 2014

Edx:

Resilience https://www.edx.org/course/uwashingtonx/uwashingtonx-ecfs311x-becoming-resilient-1652#.UznR_Gco-M9  6th May,2014


We have been informed that “It is against Kiva’s terms of use http://www.kiva.org/legal/terms to use team message boards or personal lender pages for self-promotion or to solicit funding for things not related to Kiva.”

For anyone needing further information about Kiva's policy on people requesting money for themselves, other individuals or organisations on Kiva web pages please contact Kiva.

Safe Girls Team Captains.

teams.name: LOTUS: Lend Out To Uplift Self-sufficiency
teams.loan_because: We care about people striving to enhance their economic self-sufficiency and wish to support their entrepreneurial endeavors. It just takes one small step by each of us lending on kiva. Together we can make it easier for hard working people to get the much-needed capital to sustain and grow their business. We feel blessed to be able to support the aspirations of so many loan recipients who persevere tenaciously for a better quality of life with dignity. Kudos to Kiva.org that allows us to connect for this common cause.
teams.description:
In our team, we have a vision to change lives in novel ways. Our team's origin began with a Kiva Card (gift certificate) whose recipient founded this team. Inspired by Kiva Fellow, Jessica Heinzelman's talk, our founder dreamed to take us on a cruise, beyond the realm of lending targets and team statistics. Frequent & occasional lenders are free to choose who to lend to, how much and when in an amiable team ambience nurtured by Kiva Fellows, Kiva Editor & Translators, artists, writers, entrepreneurs, workers, retired people, families, parent + kid(s), students, teachers, and professionals. Our diversity & portfolio enable our discovery of social values inherent in the Kiva micro-lending ecosystem whose issues we debate objectively. Experienced members are gratified to enhance our grasp of nuances in lending. We wish to work with volunteers in the team, Kiva Friends, http://kivafriends.org and our supporters to engage in activities that promote Kiva. Our journey to strengthen and grow the Kiva ecosystem has room for more. JOIN NOW, and check out our team, to convince yourself that it can be your team too.

LINKS TO SEE ALSO:
1. Kiva Updates:http://www.kiva.org/updates/kiva 
2. KF Blogs:http://www.kiva.org/updates/fellows 

(Thanks Anh D Pham for letting LOTUS team on Kiva to use the exquisite image of the lotus flower you photographed in Vietnam)

Also see our Perpetual Fund lender account which allows people to designate funds for perpetual loaning here on Kiva, http://www.kiva.org/lender/P2PPerpetualFund

We have a special purpose fund to keep loans from expiring. Please join us at http://poverty2prosperity.org/sosloans to see currently funding loans from the SOS Loan fund.

NOTE:  Poverty2Prosperity is also a non-profit, and any messages not related to Kiva or Poverty2Prosperity may be deleted.  If there is an idea you would like to share, contact one of the Team Captains to get permission.  Thank you for your consideration.

teams.loan_because:
After stumbling into a job as a luxury travel writer, I saw so much poverty that I decided to turn those paychecks into Kiva loans. Then I visited a bunch of clients, who were amazing, and I've written a book about it called "The International Bank of Bob" (Walker/Bloomsbury, March 5, 2013).

I hope the book will get more people to feel a greater understanding of Kiva, a better appreciation of the role of microfinance, and most of all, more connected to the rest of the world.
